etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek edaphos ‘floor’ + sauros ‘lizard’

definitions: a large herbivorous synapsid reptile of the late Carboniferous and early Permian periods, with long knobbly spines on its back supporting a sail-like crest.

notes.text: Genus Edaphosaurus, order Pelycosuria, subclass Synapsida

shortDefinitions: large herbivorous synapsid reptile of late Carboniferous and early Permian periods, with long knobbly spines on its back supporting sail-like crest
